p.value:
Institutional records of New York University are closed for a period of 20 years from the date of their creation (the date on which each document was written). Board of Trustees records are similarly closed for 35 years from the date of creation. The opening date for files spanning several years will be 20 years from the most recent date. Access will be given to material already 20 years old contained within a collection that is not yet open when such material can be isolated from the rest of the collection. 
Materials related to personnel, faculty grievances, job searches and all files with information that falls under the University's Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) policy are permanently restricted. 
Please contact the University Archivists with specific questions regarding restrictions.
Folders are arranged alphabetically by subject heading then chronologically thereafter.
The files are grouped into 1 series:

Charles Mundy Edwards, Jr. was born in 1905 in Richmond, VA. After receiving a B.S. in Business Administration from the University of Richmond, Edwards came to NYU to earn his Masters at the School of Retailing and then his Doctorate at the Graduate School of Business Administration. Retailing had been taught at NYU since 1916, when NYU first offered courses through the School of Pedagogy for training in retail. This Training School for Teachers of Retail Selling became the School of Retailing on April 25, 1921. In 1964, NYU converted the school into the Institute of Retail Management, and made it a unit of the Schools of Business. Edwards returned to NYU in 1930 as a lecturer at the School of Retailing. He later became a professor and in 1946 became Dean of the School. In September 1971 he resigned his position and was succeeded by Elmar O. Schaller. Edwards died in October 1985 in Summit, N.J.
Edwards, Charles, Biographical File, New York University Archives

item.value: Edwards, Charles, Biographical File, New York University Archives

corpname.value: New York University. Institute of Retail Management

p.value: The collection was donated to the University Archives by Mrs. Charles M. Edwards, Jr. in 1987.

abstract.value: This collection contains the professional papers of Charles Edwards, Dean of the School of Retailing from 1946 to 1971. Materials include course materials, personal letters, clippings, analyses of local retail establishments, and advertisements.

p.value: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Charles Edwards Papers; MC 97; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.

This collection contains the professional papers of Charles Edwards, Dean of the School of Retailing from 1946 to 1971. Materials include course materials, personal letters, clippings, analyses of local retail establishments, and advertisements.

Some materials may be restricted. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
New York University Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2641
Fax: (212) 995-4225
E-mail: university-archives@nyu.edu
